title: On the Agenda : What happening in France this week
body_text:
Tuesday
Budget — Weeks of tension come to a head in the hemicycle, with MPs in the Assemblee Nationale set to vote on the entire Social Security Financing Bill. If MPs don't pass it, then it's pretty much game over for any hopes of passing the 2026 Budget by normal means. If they do pass it, we're still not out of the woods as they will need to vote on the second part of the budget later in the month.
READ ALSO: OPINION: French budget showdown inches towards the climax✎
Sport — Monaco host Galatasaray, and Belgium’s Union Saint-Gilloise entertain Marseille in the pool phase of football’s Champions League. Meanwhile, the UEFA Women’s Champions League match between Paris Saint-Germain and OH Leuven will be streamed on Disney Plus.
Wednesday
Sport — Bilbao host champions Paris Saint-Germain in the pool phase of football’s Champions League. Manchester United v OL Lyonnes in the UEFA Women’s Champions League is on Disney Plus.
Thursday
Courts — Judges at the Toulouse Administrative Court of Appeal will examine the State’s appeal against a ruling in February to annul environmental authorisations for the construction of the A69 motorway between Toulouse and Castres. The February decision brought work to a halt for several months, before a stay pending this hearing allowed it to resume in the summer.
READ ALSO Work on controversial autoroute in south-west France to resume after court stay
Friday
Tunnel — The Mont Blanc tunnel will reopen in both directions after a 15-week closure for the work on the vaults on two sections approximately 8km from the French entrance.
Sport — The second weekend of rugby’s Champions and Challenge Cups kicks off with Montpellier hosting Zebre.
TV — Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery, the third film in the series which stars Daniel Craig, is released on Netflix. Writer and director Rian Johnson has hinted this may not be the last time we see fictional detective Benoit Blanc.
Saturday
Consumer — A reminder: this is the penultimate weekend before Christmas, for anyone who hasn’t yet started shopping for gifts for loved ones.
Postal deadlines - if you're sending Christmas gifts to the USA, the deadline for posting is usually December 13th. It might be wise to allow extra time this year due to the rule change on customs duties.
Sport — La Rochelle are in South Africa to face Stormers, Clermont host Sale Sharks, Bordeaux entertain Scarlets, and Toulouse travel to Glasgow Warriors in rugby’s Champions Cup; while Perpignan are at Benneton, Stade Francais are away at Cheetahs, and Montauban host Ospreys in the Challenge Cup.
Sunday
Sport — Bayonne are at Harlequins, Castres welcome Edinburgh to Stade Pierre Fabre, Toulon take on Bath, and Pau head to Bristol as the second weekend of Champions Cup rugby draws to a close. In the Challenge Cup, Racing 92 host Exeter, while Lyon are at Dragons.
